evidence.pdf_reference: Photocatalytic CO 2 reduction experiments were carried out to evaluate the photocatalytic properties of the as-prepared samples.As shown in Fig. 11a, successful CO 2 conversion into CH 4 and CH 3 OH occurred in the presence of g-C 3 N 4 photocatalysts.Obviously, the generation rates of both CH 4 and CH 3 OH for NS-CN are greatly enhanced, which are 10 and 5 times higher than the corresponding values obtained for the bulk-CN, respectively. The in situ FTIR spectra of NS-CN were analyzed to understand the

decrease of the photocurrent to zero.Hence, the enrichment of photogenerated electrons in the delocalized p bonds can reduce the recombination of photogenerated electrons and holes, and consequently facilitate the photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 molecules and formation of CH 4 and CH 3 OH, which are eightelectron and six-electron processes of CO 2 photoreduction, respectively. EIS Nyquist plots obtained for the bulk-CN and NS-CN are shown in Fig. 13b.In the analog equivalent circuit (inset of Fig. 13b), R

carbonyl groups, respectively. 48,50CH 4 was not detected due to its nonpolar nature and low affinity toward the g-C 3 N 4 surface.It is clear that prior to irradiation, primary carbonate species were rst detected on the surface of the photocatalyst in the presence of CO 2 and water vapor in the reaction system.Aer the irradiation of monochromatic light (365 nm), formate, formaldehyde and methanol appeared and their amount gradually increased accompanied by a simultaneous decrease of carbonate species,
